cogimag.java.keyboard

Class RoboSteno

  • java.lang.Object
    • cogimag.java.keyboard.RoboSteno

  • public class RoboSteno
extends java.lang.Object
    Adaptation of Robot for use with the KeyMap in this package

    • Constructor Summary

    • Constructor Detail

      • RoboSteno

        public RoboSteno(KeyMap m)
        The robot must be linked to a KeyMap in order to look up the correct CharConstruction object. In contrast to the KeyEventDispatcher, the map is passed to the constructor, rather than to a static method. Since the constructor is needed for other functions, the map may as well be passed here. Instantiating a new Robot for every typing event is deemed extravagant. The application may keep one instance of the RoboSteno for the duration.
        Parameters:
        m - the language-specific KeyMap to which characters will be matched

    • Method Detail

      • type

        public void type(CharConstruction charCon)
        Fundamental typing method. Overloaded methods call this to print characters on the screen. Method checks for availability of the Robot. If offline, no chars are typed, no Exception is thrown.
        Parameters:
        charCon - the CharConstruction object representing the character to be typed

      • type

        public void type(char c)
        Alternate argument type, depending on the designer's preference
        Parameters:
        c - a single char that will be repeated by the Robot

      • type

        public void type(int ascii_number)

      • type

        public void type(java.lang.String s)
        Useful for typing longer texts.
        Parameters:
        s - a String of unspecified length that will be broken up and typed one letter at at time.

      • testAccent

        public void testAccent()
        failed experiment to type é
